greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of preferential arrangements of n labeled elements when at least k=5 elements per rank are required.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
formula: E.g.f.: 1/(2 + x - exp(x) + x^2/2! + x^3/3! + x^4/4!). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 02 2014
a(n) ~ n! / ((1+r^4/4!) * r^(n+1)), where r = 2.376178375424367122... is the root of the equation 2 + r - exp(r) + r^2/2! + r^3/3! + r^4/4! = 0. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 02 2014
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[1/(2 + x - E^x + x^2/2! + x^3/3! + x^4/4!),{x,0,30}],x]*Range[0,30]! (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 02 2014 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 01 2014
